summary: ![CDATA[NSDL announced a Rs 2 per share final dividend for FY25, totaling Rs 40 crore. Past dividends stood at 50% for FY23 and FY24. However, future payouts remain uncertain, per its RHP. SEBI has restricted dividends beyond 15% holdings for NSE and IDBI.

title: NSDL IPO: Check dividends for last 3 financial years and dividend policy
summary: NSDL announced a Rs 2 per share final dividend for FY25, totaling Rs 40 crore. Past dividends stood at 50% for FY23 and FY24. However, future payouts remain uncertain, per its RHP. SEBI has restricted dividends beyond 15% holdings for NSE and IDBI.
fullContent: NSDL announced a Rs 2 per share final dividend for FY25, totaling Rs 40 crore. Past dividends stood at 50% for FY23 and FY24. However, future payouts remain uncertain, per its RHP. SEBI has restricted dividends beyond 15% holdings for NSE and IDBI. The IPO saw strong subscription and GMP.

summary: ![CDATA[Lava International's MD, Sunil Raina, has accused JioHotstar of infringing on their registered tagline, #ProudlyIndian, sparking debate online. Raina highlighted the five-year registration of the tagline, expressing surprise at JioHotstar's alleged lack of originality.

title: JioHotstar accused of copying Lava’s tagline, MD Sunil Raina calls out Ambani-owned platform for ‘lack of originality’
summary: Lava International's MD, Sunil Raina, has accused JioHotstar of infringing on their registered tagline, #ProudlyIndian, sparking debate online. Raina highlighted the five-year registration of the tagline, expressing surprise at JioHotstar's alleged lack of originality.
fullContent: Lava International's MD, Sunil Raina, has accused JioHotstar of infringing on their registered tagline, #ProudlyIndian, sparking debate online. Raina highlighted the five-year registration of the tagline, expressing surprise at JioHotstar's alleged lack of originality. While some support Lava's claim, others argue the tagline's generic nature and potential trademark class differences.

fullContent: Noting Q1 miss and slower than expected deployment of IPO proceeds to drive growth, Dolat Capital lowers revenue estimates by 9%/7%.
